default: (a) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon} or (b) 1 {@item longsword|phb} OR {@item rapier|phb}

classFeatures.name: Blood Pool
entries: Starting at 1st level, you have a pool of blood that you can use as a buffer when you use your blood manipulation. These are represented by a number of d4s equal to twice your Hemomancer level. You’ll expend these “Blood Dice” to use your hemomancer abilities. Anytime you spend one of your Blood Dice, you roll them and take damage equal to the amount you rolled.

Additionally, as a bonus action you can expend one hit die to replenish 2 Blood Dice. When you do you roll your hit die as if you were restoring hit points during a short rest, but instead you take damage equal to the result.
At higher levels your Blood Dice increases in size, becoming a d6 at 5th level, a d8 at 11th level, and finally a d10 at 17th level.

classFeatures.name: Blood Manipulation
entries: Also starting at 1st level, you have a certain control over the blood inside of you. You have access to the following abilities starting at 1st level :

entries.name: Blood Forge
entries: Whenever you roll initiative (or as a bonus action on your turn) you can spend one of your blood dice and manifest a weapon made of your own blood. This blood weapon can be any simple weapon that lacks the “special” property. The weapon uses your Blood Dice size to determine its damage die and you can either use the weapon’s damage type or necrotic damage. In addition, as part of the forging you create up to 10 pieces of ammunition for any ranged weapons. You can spend an additional Blood Die to increase the damage dice by 1. This weapon remains manifested for 1 hour, until you take a short or long rest, or you can dismiss it as a bonus action. You can use your wisdom modifier for the attack and damage rolls for this weapon instead of Strength or Dexterity. For every hour after you manifested this weapon,  you can spend an additional blood die and roll it to keep it manifested. At any time while your blood weapon is manifested, you can use a bonus action to reforge the weapon into a different one, without spending Blood Dice.

entries.name: Bloody Tendrils
entries: As a bonus action you spend a number of Blood Dice up to your Wisdom Modifier and can create a number of tendrils of blood equal to the amount of Blood Dice spent. Each tendril has a number of hit points equal to your Hemomancer level. Whenever you would take damage, as a reaction one of your tendrils can become a target for the attack, taking the damage for itself. When a tendril drops to 0 hit points it is destroyed. Each of these tendrils deals necrotic damage equal to the size of your blood die and has a reach of 10 ft. When you take the attack action, you can forgo your weapon attack to instead attack with your Tendrils, making 1 attack for each tendril you have when you take the attack action. Your Bloody Tendrils count as simple weapons and use your wisdom modifier to hit but does not add it to damage rolls. On a successful hit the target is grappled, Escape DC equals your Hemomancer Save DC. Once you have summoned your Bloody Tendrils you cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest. Alternatively, you can spend and roll a hit die to regain a usage of your Bloody Tendrils, taking damage equal to what you rolled.

entries.name: Blood Barrier
entries: As a reaction on your turn, you can spend 2 of your blood dice to add your Wisdom Modifier to your AC and take no damage from the Magic Missile spell. This benefit lasts until the start of your next turn.

classFeatures.name: Bloody Archetype Feature
entries: At 1st level, you gain a feature from your chosen Bloody Archetype

classFeatures.name: Blood Disciplines
entries: Blood Disciplines are additional extensions of your blood manipulation’s capabilities. These disciplines make every Hemomancer unique from the other, as some will master arts that others would not. You have 2 Blood Disciplines starting at 2nd level and gain more upon leveling up as shown in the Hemomancer Table

classFeatures.name: Bloody Restoration
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you gain the uncanny ability to heal after short instances of time. You restore half of your hit point maximum after a short rest, in addition when you spend a hit die to restore hit points you double the result.

classFeatures.name: Blood Bath
entries: As a bonus action on your turn you can enter a Blood Bath. While your Blood Bath is active you take 2 points of damage at the start of each of your turns. In addition you gain the following benefits :

items: You have resistance to slashing, bludgeoning, and piercing damage.
When you make an attack roll that uses Strength or Wisdom you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll. This bonus increases by 1 at 5th, 11th, and 17th levels.
You have advantage on Wisdom and Constitution Saving Throws.

Once per round when you would take damage from a Hemomancer feature (except for this feature.), you can choose to not take damage. Doing so gives you vulnerability to the next damage roll you would suffer. This nullifies the resistance to slashing, bludgeoning, or piercing damage you would have otherwise been resistant to.
When you deal damage to a creature using a Blood Weapon or a Bloody Tendril you replenish 1 Blood Die.

entries: Your Blood Bath remains active so long as you take damage, make an attack roll, or prolong it as a bonus action. If by the end of your turn you do not do any of the following, your Blood Bath ends. Once your Blood Bath ends you cannot enter a Blood Bath again until you have finished a short or long rest. You gain an additional use of your Blood Bath at 9th and 15th levels.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Blood Manipulation Improvement
entries: Starting at 5th level you gain the following Blood Manipulation abilities :

As an action by spending a blood die, you can transmute up to 4 ounces of blood into 4 ounces of any of the following liquids : Water, Oil, Ale, Beer, Vinegar, Wine, Basic poison, Acid, Honey, Mayonnaise. You can transmute it into other basic liquids under the GM’s discretion.

As an action by spending a blood die, you can transmute up to 4 ounces of blood into 4 ounces of any of the following liquids : Water, Oil, Ale, Beer, Vinegar, Wine, Basic poison, Acid, Honey, Mayonnaise. You can transmute it into other basic liquids under the GM’s discretion.

classFeatures.name: Bloody Archetype Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature from your chosen Bloody Archetype

classFeatures.name: Magic Infused Blood
entries: Starting at 7th level, your Blood Weapons and Bloody Tendrils count as magical for the purposes of overcoming magical resistances.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Blood Magic
entries: Starting at 10th level you gain the capabilities to cast magic through your control over blood. Pick three cantrips from the Wizard’s Spell list, you can now cast those cantrips using Wisdom as your Spellcasting Ability. Pick two 1st, 2nd, and 3rd level spells each from the Wizard’s Spell List. You can cast each of these spells, using Wisdom as your Spellcasting Ability, by spending a Blood Die per level of the spell. Once you have cast a spell using this feature you cannot cast that spell again until you have finished a short or long rest. You pick 2 additional spells of 1st, 2nd, 3rd, or 4th levels at 16th level.

classFeatures.name: Blood Manipulation Improvement
entries: Starting at 11th level, you gain the following Blood Manipulation Abilities :

entries.name: Bloody Vitality
entries: As an action by spending a hit die you or an ally within 30ft of you can gain an amount of temporary hit points equal to the result. If you give it to an ally you can roll a blood die to boost the temporary hit points by an amount equal to the result.

entries.name: Bloody Mary
entries: You can release outward  a burst of blood. Each creature, including yourself, within 30ft of you must make a Dexterity Saving Throw. You automatically fail this saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes necrotic damage equal to twice your Hemomancer level and their speed is reduced to 0. On a success they take damage equal to your Hemomancer level and their speed is not reduced.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Iron Blood
entries: Starting at 13th level, you have resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws against being poisoned. In addition you are immune to disease.

classFeatures.name: Bloody Archetype feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature from your chosen Bloody Archetyoe

classFeatures.name: Strong Blooded
entries: At 15th level choose Strength or Dexterity, you add half your Proficiency Bonus to Ability Checks and Saving Throws using the chosen ability score. In addition, you have advantage on Death Saves.

classFeatures.name: Blood Manipulation Improvement
entries: Starting at 17th level you gain the following Blood Manipulation Abilities :

entries.name: Bloody Curse
entries: As a bonus action choose 1 creature within 60 ft. That creature takes additional necrotic damage equal to your proficiency bonus when you hit them with a Blood Weapon or a Bloody Tendril. In addition, when you reduce that creature to 0 hit points you restore 1 blood die. Also when the cursed creature falls to 0 hit points, as bonus action you can move the curse to another target within 60 ft.

entries.name: Bloody Demise
entries: As an action you can absorb blood from a corpse that has been dead for no longer than 4 hours within 10 ft of you. You gain an amount of Blood Dice into your Blood Pool equal to their CR. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

classFeatures.name: Bloody Archetype feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature from your chosen Bloody Archetype

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Blood Control
entries: At 20th level, you have attained the ultimate control over your Blood Manipulation. You gain the following abilities as a result:

items: When you would take damage from a Hemomancer feature, you can choose to take no damage instead. You can do this a number of times equal to your Constitution Modifier.
When you roll initiative you regain an amount of Blood Dice equal to your Wisdom Modifier. You can use your Blood Bath an unlimited amount of times.
Choose 1 of your Blood Magic spells. You can cast that spell at its lowest level at will an unlimited amount of times.

subclassFeatures.name: Blood Bender
entries: The powers to bend and control blood, most would consider this act evil and chaotic, some would argue that it depends on the user and how they choose to use their power. As a Blood Bender you will have the powers to bend and weave the blood around you to your whim.

subclassFeatures.name: Blood Bending
entries: Starting at 1st level when you choose this archetype you learn the “Shape Water” cantrip, but instead of being able to shape water, you instead shape blood. At 4th level you learn the Hold Person spell, at 7th level you learn the Hold Monster Spell, and at 9th level you learn the Dominate Person Spell. Each of these spells uses your Wisdom as your Spellcasting Ability. Each spell of 1st level or higher using this feature can only be used once per short or long rest and cost an amount of blood dice per level of the spell. Each spell must be cast at their lowest level.

subclassFeatures.name: Additional Blood Manipulation Abilities
entries: Starting at 1st level, these abilities are added into your “Blood Manipulation” Feature.

entries.name: Blood Transfusion
entries: As a bonus action, by spending an amount of blood dice up to your proficiency bonus you can restore an amount of hit points to one ally, not including yourself, that you can see within 10 ft of you equal to the amount rolled by the dice. This healing has no effect on undead or constructs.

entries.name: Blood Absorption
entries: Once per round, whenever an ally or enemy within 5 ft of you takes 5 or more slashing, piercing, or necrotic damage you gain 5 temporary hit points. The amount of times per round this can be used increases by 1 at 5th level, 1 more at 11th level, and finally once again at 17th level. This effect can stack up to a maximum of 20 temp hp.

subclassFeatures.name: Enhanced Blood Pool
entries: Also starting at 1st level, your blood pool maximum is doubled. In addition you regain half of your blood dice (rounded up) after a short rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Blood Bolstering
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can target a number of allies within 60 ft of you (not including yourself) equal to your Wisdom Modifier. You can expend 2 Blood Dice to grant them temporary hit points equal to the amount you rolled. In addition they gain advantage on their next saving throw. This feature is added to your “Blood Manipulation” feature.

subclassFeatures.name: Adrenaline Rush
entries: Starting at 14th level, as an action by spending 8 Blood Dice you and a number of allies within 60 ft of you equal to your Wisdom Modifier gain the following benefits:

items: They have advantage on their ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws.
They gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your Hemomancer level.
Their movement speed is increased by 10 ft and they can take the dash action as a bonus action.
They gain an additional action that they can only use to make 1 weapon attack, disengage, dodge, or use an object.

entries: These benefits last for 1 minute, afterwards everyone who benefited from this ability suffers 1 level of exhaustion. In addition, you take an amount of damage equal to twice your Hemomancer level. Once you use this feature you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Overflowing Blood
entries: Starting at 18th level, whenever you enter your Blood Bath you lose 2 additional hit points at the start of each of your turns, but you restore conscious allies within 30 ft of you 4 hit points. In addition, whenever you deal damage using a Blood Manipulation feature you deal an additional 2 damage.

In addition, while in your Blood Bath when a creature would hit you or an ally within 30 ft of you with an attack, or when they would cast a spell in an area that would harm an ally, you can spend 4 Blood Dice to change the designated target to a point within range of the original weapon or spell.

subclassFeatures.name: Blood Invoker
entries: Why bother trying to improve your feeble body with “Physical Labor” when you can do it when it matters and only when it matters. You fight for yourself, to keep yourself alive. If others get hurt, who cares? At least you’ll survive. That’s all that matters.

subclassFeatures.name: Blood Invocation
entries: Starting at 1st level when you take this archetype you can cast the Blade Ward cantrip as a bonus action. At 4th level you can cast the Enhance Ability spell but only on yourself. At 7th level you can cast the Death Ward spell but only on yourself, and at 9th level you can cast the Negative Energy Flood spell. Each of these spells uses your Wisdom Modifier. Each spell of 1st level or higher using this feature can only be used once per short rest or long rest and cost a blood die per level of the spell. Each spell must be cast at their lowest level.

subclassFeatures.name: Additional Blood Manipulation Abilities
entries: Starting at 1st level, these abilities are added into your “Blood Manipulation” Feature.

entries.name: Blood Enhancement
entries: As a bonus action by spending 2 blood dice you can make your Strength and Dexterity scores equal to your Wisdom Score. If they are equal to or greater than your Wisdom Score this feature provides no benefit. This benefit lasts for a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom Modifier. Once this effect ends you suffer 1 level of exhaustion.

entries.name: Blood Rite
entries: As a bonus action on your turn by spending 1 blood die you can call upon the powers of the elements. Choose fire, cold, lightning, radiant, or necrotic damage. Your weapon attacks deal an additional amount of damage of the chosen type equal to the size of your blood die for up to 1 minute. You can end this effect early as a bonus action. You can boost the power of this rite by spending an additional blood die and additional damage die. Once you boost the power of this rite, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Enhanced Vitality
entries: Also starting at 1st level, you gain 1 additional hit point and 1 more each time you gain a Hemomancer level. In addition, anytime you restore hit points using potions or other magical means, you regain additional hit points equal to your Hemomancer level.

You have a seperate pool of temporary hit points that can only be used for the cost of your Hemomancer features. You have a number of temporary hit points in this pool equal to your twice your Hemomancer level. This is known as your “Blood Reserve”. Your Blood Reserve is replenished after a long rest. If your Blood Reserve is reduced to 0, you suffer a level of exhaustion. This level of exhaustion can only be restored after completing a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Bloody Reflexes
entries: At 6th level you add your Wisdom Modifier to your Initiative checks. In addition, you can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a red dragon's fiery breath or an ice storm spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can spend a blood die to instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

subclassFeatures.name: Improved Blood Arts
entries: At 14th level your Blood Weapons and Bloody Tendrils become faster and deadlier. Whenever you take the attack action you can make up to two attacks with your blood weapons instead of one. In addition, your blood weapons and bloody tendrils score a critical hit on a 19 or 20.

subclassFeatures.name: Blood Rage
entries: Starting at 18th level when you use your Blood Bath, you can lash out at nearby creatures. You can spend any number of Blood Dice, each creature within 10 ft of you must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Hemomancer Save DC. On a failed save, they take necrotic damage equal to what you rolled and are knocked prone. On a success they take half damage and are not knocked prone. Then, for a number of rounds equal to the number of blood dice spent, you deal the maximum possible damage to creatures with your weapon attacks.

subclassFeatures.name: Lycanthropy
entries: Humanity is a small price to pay for power, let the madness overcome you so that your true power can flourish. Release the inner beast within you, unshackle the monster and let loose. Your enemies are your target, your allies an obstacle. Let no one get in your way, destroy anything that does. Lycanthropy comes in many forms. Each version of the curse is bound to a specific beast: wolf, bear, tiger, boar, and rat are a few of the more well-known variations.

subclassFeatures.name: Curse of the Lycan
entries: Beginning at 1st level, choose Wolf, Bear, Tiger, Boar, or Rat. You gain a hybrid transformation that varies based on what you choose. As an action for up to 10 minutes on your turn you can transform into your Lycan form, doing so will grant you effects depending on what beast you chose. Once your transformation ends you cannot transform again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Any
entries: You gain Bite and Claw attacks. They both use strength and deal 1d8 piercing or slashing damage of your choice. You gain vulnerability to damage from silvered weapons. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and smell. You gain a darkvision for up to 60ft. You cannot discern color in this darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Wolf
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks. You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Bear
entries: Your creature size increases by 1 stage. In addition when you take damage you can reduce that damage by 1d4. You can only reduce damage in this way once per round. This damage reduction increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th, 11th, and 17th levels.

entries.name: Tiger
entries: Your movement speed increases by 10 ft. Your jump distance is doubled. If you move at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hit it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC: 8 + Proficiency + Strength) or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, you can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Boar
entries: You gain a tusk attack. (Uses the bite and claws stats) If you move at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with your tusks on the same turn, the target takes an extra 1d6 slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC: 8 + Proficiency + Strength) or be knocked prone. Once per round if you would take damage equal to your Hemomancer level or less that would reduce you to 0 hit points, you instead remain at 1 hit point.

entries.name: Rat
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Raven
entries: You have a fly speed equal to your walking speed. You cannot fly if you are wearing medium or heavy armor. You have talons that you can use to attack at a reach of 15 ft. These talons do a d6 of piercing damage and use your Strength or Dexterity to attack.

subclassFeatures.name: Lycan Madness
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you enter your Blood Bath you can immediately enter your Lycan form. When you enter your Lycan form while under the effects of Blood Bath you gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom Modifier at the start of each of your turns unless you are hit by a silvered weapon. In addition your Lycan weapons (claws, bite, etc.) deal necrotic damage equal to your Wisdom Modifier and count as Blood Weapons. Whenever you take damage from an ally, whether it be from a spell - misfire - etc., make a Wisdom Saving Throw against your Hemomancer Save DC. On a failed save you go into a frenzy, and you are under the effects of the Enemies Abound spell. The spell ends when your Blood Bath ends.

subclassFeatures.name: Dark Howl
entries: Starting at 14th level, as an action while in your Lycan form you can let out a howling roar. Each creature that can hear you must make a Constitution Saving Throw against your Hemomancer Save DC. On a failed save they take 4d10 thunder damage and are stunned for 1d4 rounds. On a successful save they take half as much damage and are not stunned. You gain 1 blood die for each creature that took damage from this effect.

subclassFeatures.name: Mastered Lycan
entries: Starting at 18th level, you are always under the effects of your Lycan form, but can retain your regular appearance. In addition as an action by spending 2 Blood Dice you can transform into the true form of the beast you chose. When you transform you retain your class features, statistics, and skill proficiencies. You can transform into the following beasts depending on what you chose for your Curse of Lycan.

entries.name: Wolf
entries: Dire Wolf, Wolf, Winter Wolf

entries.name: Bear
entries: Brown Bear, Black Bear, Cave Bear, Polar Bear, Huge Polar Bear

entries.name: Tiger
entries: Tiger, Sabertooth Tiger

entries.name: Boar
entries: Boar, Giant Boar

entries.name: Rat
entries: Rat, Giant Rat

entries.name: Raven
entries: Raven, Giant Raven

As a Hemomancer, there are 3 different paths you can choose to walk. You can use your abilities to manipulate blood to heal your allies and enhance their abilities, you can alter your own blood and make yourself more powerful, or perhaps you gained your powers after committing yourself to take on the Lycanthropy curse and in doing so you’ve torn away your humanity to become something far greater.
fluff.name: Hemomancer

optionalfeature.name: Blood Armor
entries: You can cast mage armor on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components. Instead of adding your Dexterity modifier, you instead add your Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Death Grip
entries: Whenever you hit with an attack using your Bloody Tendrils, the target becomes grappled. While grappled in this way, instead of making an attack roll (except the turn it was grappled) your attack automatically hits the target when using a Bloody Tendril. You can use this feature once per round.

optionalfeature.name: Masking Blood
entries: You can manifest a masking layer of blood to hide your true self.  By spending a Blood Die, you can cast the Disguise Self spell at will using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

optionalfeature.name: Bloody Form
entries: As an action on your turn you gain the ability to shapechange into an ooze type creature. While in your Bloody Form you have the Amorphous feature. (You can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.) While in this form you have resistance to slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage from non-magical attacks. In addition, you are immune to being prone and blinded. While in this form you have disadvantage on charisma checks against creatures whom you are not familiar with, or they are not familiar with you. In addition you cannot use your normal senses, instead you have a blindsight for up to 60 ft, and you are blind beyond that point. You cannot take the attack action or cast spells while in your Bloody Form. While in this form you can understand the languages you know, but you can’t read or speak. It is an action to shapechange back into normal form.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Companion
entries: You can spend a Blood Die to cast the Find Familiar spell at will without material components using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability. This Familiar gains an attack that it can use during combat, Blood Shot, but it can only attack using this trait. Blood Shot. Ranged Weapon Attack, Proficiency + DEX to hit, range 60 ft, one creature. Hit: 1d4 necrotic damage. As an action the familiar can shapechange into an ooze type creature, when it does it loses its Blood Shot attack and gains the Amorphous feature. (You can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.) While in this form it has resistance to slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage from non-magical attacks. In addition, it is immune to being prone and blinded. In addition it cannot use its normal senses, instead it has a blindsight for up to 60 ft, and it is blind beyond that point. It is an action to shapechange back into normal form.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Beam
entries: You gain the Eldritch Blast cantrip using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability, but it deals necrotic damage instead. You can increase the damage by 1d10 for each ray by spending a blood die for each ray you boost.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Senses
entries: You gain a darkvision of up to 60 ft. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by an additional 60 ft. In addition you know the general location of exposed blood within 120 ft of you. You cannot detect a person’s blood in this way who is in total cover.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Affinity
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Medicine) checks. In addition when you successfully clean a wound that involves bleeding you can replenish 1 Blood Die into your blood pool.

optionalfeature.name: False Death
entries: You can cast the Feign Death spell at will without material components using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability, but only on yourself.  You can end the spell as a bonus action on your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Eviscerate
entries: When you make the attack action using your Bloody Tendrils, they deal an additional amount of slashing damage equal to your Wisdom Modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Bleeding Rays
entries: By spending 2 Blood Dice, you can cast the Scorching Ray spell at its lowest level at will using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability. Instead of dealing fire damage it deals necrotic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Scorching Blood
entries: When you are hit by a creature within 5ft of you by a melee attack that deals slashing, piercing, or necrotic damage; the attacker takes acid damage equal to your Wisdom Modifier (minimum of 1).

optionalfeature.name: Great Weapon Forging
entries: When you use your Blood Forge feature you can forge martial weapons and two-handed blood weapons. Forging either of these options costs an additional blood die. For the purposes of a versatile weapon, holding the weapon in two hands increases the damage dice by 1 size. Ex. 1d8 turns into a d10, 1d10 into a d12, etc. A weapon that has the Two-Handed Property adds an additional damage die to the damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Chilling Blood
entries: You can cast the Armor of Agathys spell at will at 3rd level without material components using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability. Once you use this trait you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Spiteful Blood
entries: You can spend 3 Blood Dice to cast the Bane spell at will at 3rd level without material components using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability. Once you use this trait you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Toxic Blood
entries: Whenever you hit a creature using a blood weapon or your bloody tendrils, the creature must make a Constitution Saving Throw against your Hemomancer Save DC. On a failed save, the creature is poisoned until the start of your next turn. On a success the target is immune to the effects of this feature until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Unstable Blood Magic
entries: Whenever you cast a spell using your Hemomancer features, roll a d10. On a 3 or lower your blood magic goes wild. Roll from the Wild Magic chart provided by the Wild Magic Sorcerer, except any effect that includes sorcery points uses Blood Dice instead and any effect that involves spell slots can instead regain the usage of one of your Blood Magic spells of the appropriate slot level. If you have spell slots, then the effect can apply as normal. When your blood magic goes wild you gain 10 temporary hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Impatient Adrenaline
entries: When you take the dash action, you can spend a blood die to double your movement speed. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution Modifier. You regain all expended uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Fluidity of Blood
entries: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. If you already had a swimming speed, it increases by 30 ft. In addition you can breathe water as if you could breathe air.

optionalfeature.name: Destructive Blood
entries: When you hit with a weapon attack using your blood weapons or bloody tendrils, you can deal an additional 2d10 force damage by spending 2 blood dice. In addition, your blood weapons and bloody tendrils deal double damage to structures and objects.

optionalfeature.name: Bloody Ambush
entries: When you have advantage to hit on a creature, or you attack a creature that is suprised, the target takes an additional 5d6 damage and is stunned until the end of their next turn. You can only gain the benefits of this feature once per round.

optionalfeature.name: Vampiric Weapons
entries: When you successfully hit a creature with your Blood Weapons or Bloody Tendrils, you replenish one Blood Die into your blood pool. In addition, you gain an amount of temporary hit points equal to half the damage you dealt.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Vitality
entries: While you are conscious, you regain an amount of hit points at the start of your turn equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down). If you take any form of fire or cold damage you do not gain this benefit. In addition, the first time you would be knocked unconscious as a result of falling to zero hit points, you can spend your reaction to remain at 1 instead. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Corrosive Blood
entries: While your blood bath is active, when you successfully hit a creature with a blood weapon or your bloody tendrils they suffer a -2 penalty to their AC until the start of your next turn. A creature can only suffer the penalties of this feature once per round.

optionalfeature.name: Reduced Agony
entries: Whenever you take damage, as a reaction you can reduce the amount of damage you would take by 1d10 + your Wisdom Modifier. If you reduce the damage to 0, immediately you can spend a blood die to make a single weapon attack using a blood weapon or a bloody tendril. You have a number of uses of this feature equal to your Constitution Modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Blood Weapons
entries: Your Blood Weapons and Bloody Tendrils now gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. In addition, whenever you make a weapon attack using a Blood Weapon or Bloody Tendril, as a bonus action by spending a blood die, you can gain advantage on one attack you make with that chosen weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Permanent Blood Weapon
entries: If you spend a 1 hour ritual concentrating on your Blood Weapon, you can have the weapon forged for an indefinite amount of time, no longer requiring concentration on the weapon. In addition, the weapon cannot be destroyed by non-magical means. You can only have 1 Permanent Blood Weapon at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Vortex
entries: By spending six Blood Dice, you create a 5ft tall and 30 ft radius swirling vortex of blood centered on yourself for 1 minute. The area within the vortex counts as difficult terrain. The vortex moves with you and ignores half and three quarters cover. Each creature, except yourself, within range must make a Strength saving throw against your Hemomancer Save DC. The vortex deals 6d10 necrotic damage on a failed save and they are dragged 10ft closer to the center. On a successful save they take half as much damage and are not dragged. You concentrate on this feature as if you were concentrating on a spell, when you lose concentration the vortex ends early.

optionalfeature.name: Everlasting Horror
entries: While you are conscious, every hostile creature that can see you must make a wisdom saving throw against your Hemomancer Save DC. On a failed save, they are frightened. While frightened by you in this way, they go into a panic and can only make the attack action on you, otherwise they must use their action to hide, disengage, or dash. A creature who passes the saving throw is not frightened and immune to this feature for 1 hour. A creature can repeat their saving throw at the end of their turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blood for the Blood God
entries: When you kill a creature using a Blood Weapon or a Bloody Tendril, as a reaction you can shout “Blood for the Blood God!”. Your Blood Pool is instantly replenished and you gain an amount of temporary hit points equal to the creature’s CR. Once you use this feature you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Ultimate Vitality
entries: Once while you are conscious, you can restore hit points up to half of your hit point maximum. Once you use this feature you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sacrificial Clone
entries: You know the clone spell and can cast it once per year without requiring material components. Once, while you are unconscious if you were to die and you do not have an active clone, instead all of the blood remaining in your body, as well as your required organs, rises out and you enter your Bloody Form. When you do, you are at 1 hit point and have 3 levels of exhaustion. Your body perishes and requires a new one for the Bloody Form to enter. If you cannot find a body within an amount of days equal to your constitution modifier, you perish. Entering a new body is difficult, and requires an intense amount of willpower. As an action, make an opposing Wisdom Check against the creature whose body you are entering. The target cannot take actions or reactions until either creature succeeds. The creature that fails the opposing check receives one death failure and the winning creature receives one success. You use their statistics, but not their class features. You do gain their innate abilities, innate spellcasting, and racial traits as well as any boons, celestial gifts, etc. You replace their Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores with your own.

optionalfeature.name: Lethal Strike
entries: When you score a critical hit with a Blood Weapon or a Bloody Tendril, by spending half of your blood dice you can instantly drop the creature to 0 hit points, doing so does not outright kill them. You can use this feature once per long rest. This feature has no effect on creatures with Legendary Resistance or Legendary Actions.
